title: Should You Sell Microsoft Corp (MSFT) in Software - Infrastructure Industry?
text:
The 73 rating InvestorsObserver gives to Microsoft Corp (MSFT)  stock puts it near the top of the Software - Infrastructure industry. In addition to scoring higher than 97 percent of stocks in the Software - Infrastructure industry, MSFT’s 73 overall rating means the stock scores better than 73 percent of all stocks.





 MSFT has an Overall Score of 73. Find out what this means to you and get the rest of the rankings on MSFT!
See Full MSFT Report


What do These Ratings Mean?

Analyzing stocks can be hard. There are tons of numbers and ratios, and it can be hard to remember what they all mean and what counts as “good” for a given value. InvestorsObserver ranks stocks on eight different metrics. We percentile rank most of our scores to make it easy for investors to understand. A score of 73 means the stock is more attractive than 73 percent of stocks.


 

Our proprietary scoring system captures technical factors, fundamental analysis and the opinions of analysts on Wall Street. This makes InvestorsObserver’s overall rating a great way to get started, regardless of your investing style. Percentile-ranked scores are also easy to understand. A score of 100 is the top and a 0 is the bottom. There’s no need to try to remember what is “good” for a bunch of complicated ratios, just pay attention to which numbers are the highest.

What's Happening With Microsoft Corp Stock Today?
Microsoft Corp (MSFT) stock is lower by -0.28% while the S&P 500 is up 0.15% as of 11:08 AM on Friday, Mar 8. MSFT is lower by -$1.17 from the previous closing price of $409.14 on volume of 4,421,611 shares. Over the past year the S&P 500 has gained 31.82% while MSFT is up 61.69%. MSFT earned $11.06 a per share in the over the last 12 months, giving it a price-to-earnings ratio of 36.87.
